sentences.en: a merger between the two banks
Any conceivable merger would involve a foreign company.
sentences.cn: 可能的合并伙伴应当是一家外国公司.

sentences.en: Both companies were keen on a merger.
Firm diversification is increasingly achieved by the means of takeover and merger.
sentences.cn: 通过接管和兼并,厂商经营范围日益多样化.

sentences.en: His justification for the merger was just hot air.
sentences.cn: 他提出的合并理由只是空话连篇。

sentences.en: Members are concerned that a merger might mean higher costs, in which case they would oppose it.
sentences.cn: 成员们担心合并会导致成本提高，若是那样的话，他们将提出反对。

sentences.en: Such a merger would be the largest in US banking history, giving the two banks combined assets of some $146 billion.
sentences.cn: 这将是美国银行业历史上最大的一次合并，使两家银行的总资产达到1,460亿美元左右。

sentences.en: The managing director denied that the merger was a done deal, and said they were still in negotiations.
sentences.cn: 总经理否认合并已经敲定, 声称此事仍在商讨中.

sentences.en: The merger puts the firm in a position to triple its earnings.
sentences.cn: 合并可使公司利润增长两倍。

sentences.en: The two businesses contracted a merger.
sentences.cn: 这两家公司签约合并为一家.

sentences.en: The two companies are considering merger as a possibility.
sentences.cn: 这两家公司在考虑合并的可能性.

sentences.en: There are rumors of a merger involving several major railroad companies.
sentences.cn: 据说几家主要的铁路公司要合并了.

sentences.en: There are rumours of an impending merger.
sentences.cn: 有谣传说是快要合并了.

sentences.en: Today, we are witnessing a genuine convergence - even a merger - of astronomy and physics.
sentences.cn: 现在我们看到,天文学和物理学互相接近甚至溶合在一起了.

sentences.en: Tom and I saw great benefits for both companies in a merger.
sentences.cn: 汤姆和我都预见到两家公司合并所获得的重大利益.

words.tran_cn: （企业等的）[经]合并；并购；吸收（如刑法中重罪吸收轻罪）

trans.tran_cn: （两个公司的）合并，联合体，吸收
trans.tran_en: the joining together of two or more companies or organizations to form one larger one
